intro: Laserpitium lineatum, commonly known as the slender hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its linear, grass-like leaves and yellow-orange flower heads make it easily identifiable. It blooms from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
